name: krigia-montana
wildlife-value: Members of the genus Krigia support the following specialized bee: Andrena (Callandrena s.l.) krigiana
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
fruit-description: Oval reddish brown fruits with ridges. While the fruit type is often referred to as achene, it is actually cypsela.
flower-description: The flowers are solitary, bright yellow-orange petals with fringed tips borne on a long, 20 inch, stem. There can be several heads produced per plant. Leafy green bracts are at the base of the flower head. They consist of rays without center disc flowers. There can be 20 to 60 rays per flower. Blooms from May through September.
leaf-description: Most leaves are basal and narrow with a variable shape such as linear, lance-shaped or lobed and toothed like a dandelion. Leaves are 4 to 15 inches long.
stem-description: One to five stems, branched and usually decumbant, green, slender, milky, and mostly smooth.
